channel.title: Linksys E2500 Portforwar​ding - Need Help - Mystery has puzzled 20+ On Team View
channel.description:
I am having a bit of trouble and am looking for the help of any expert. I have been everywhere, called everyone, and team viewed with many people. No one can seem to figure out my problem. I am trying to portforward ports for online gaming.
•The two particular ones are runescape private servers, port 43594, and minecraft, port 25565. •I have a linksys e2500 router •I am currently with S&T telecommunications for my internet service. I have called them to see if they block any protocols or ports by default. They sounded pretty clueless but assured me that they do not. •My OS is Windows 7
I have followed portforwarding tutorials on how to forward these ports, followed tutorials on how to add exceptions into my Windows 7 firewall, and so on. I have pretty much exhausted all options. I have went to canyouseeme and every time I get the error code "Reason, Connection timed out"
If anyone has any new ideas or would like to aid in figuring out this mystery which has stumped me and many others, feel free to give it a shot
Thank You

item.title: Linksys E2500 Portforwar​ding - Need Help - Mystery has puzzled 20+ On Team View
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

ITI Basak ITI:

Yup, been there too

you can try using simpleportforwarding. It’s a tool that does the “dirty work” for you. I personally use it. it can be found here. Just download, install. Run. change the router to yours, enter the router login info. Set a custom port. Run. Then use the built in port checker (in tools menu) to see if it worked. Also, don’t forget to check your firewall settings.

Need any help with it? ask.

Read full topic
item.source: Linksys E2500 Portforwar​ding - Need Help - Mystery has puzzled 20+ On Team View
